<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Carry-setting nodes for multiple precision addition and subtraction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These nodes take two operands of the same value type, and produce two</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// They are kept around for now to provide a smooth transition path</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a20084f62caecb0db80ad71bdabda73c2"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a20084f62caecb0db80ad71bdabda73c2">ADDC</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Carry-using nodes for multiple precision addition and subtraction. These</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// nodes take three operands: The first two are the normal lhs and rhs to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the add or sub, and the third is the input carry flag.  These nodes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// produce two results; the normal result of the add or sub, and the output</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// carry flag.  These nodes both read and write a carry flag to allow them</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to them to be chained together for add and sub of arbitrarily large</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad116e32876f2275acf60ffb1651c9256"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad116e32876f2275acf60ffb1651c9256">ADDE</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac9246c101c0cc9232e37b3941194bb13"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac9246c101c0cc9232e37b3941194bb13">SUBE</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="289"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Carry-using nodes for multiple precision addition and subtraction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="290"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These nodes take three operands: The first two are the normal lhs and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="291"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// rhs to the add or sub, and the third is a boolean value that is 1 if and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="292"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// only if there is an incoming carry/borrow. These nodes produce two</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="293"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// results: the normal result of the add or sub, and a boolean value that is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="294"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 1 if and only if there is an outgoing carry/borrow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="295"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="296"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Care must be taken if these opcodes are lowered to hardware instructions</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="297"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that use the inverse logic -- 0 if and only if there is an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// incoming/outgoing carry/borrow.  In such cases, you must preserve the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// semantics of these opcodes by inverting the incoming carry/borrow, feeding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it to the add/sub hardware instruction, and then inverting the outgoing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// carry/borrow.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The use of these opcodes is preferable to ADDE/SUBE if the target supports</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="304"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it, as the carry is a regular value rather than a glue, which allows</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// further optimisation.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These opcodes are different from &#91;US&#93;&#123;ADD,SUB&#125;O in that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// U&#123;ADD,SUB&#125;O&#95;CARRY consume and produce a carry/borrow, whereas</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#91;US&#93;&#123;ADD,SUB&#125;O produce an overflow.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0f1e3ed26108fec69eb97209c0e39bf"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0f1e3ed26108fec69eb97209c0e39bf">UADDO&#95;CARRY</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac81ebcd59d629d8680e50ffba9855255"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac81ebcd59d629d8680e50ffba9855255">USUBO&#95;CARRY</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Carry-using overflow-aware nodes for multiple precision addition and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// subtraction. These nodes take three operands: The first two are normal lhs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and rhs to the add or sub, and the third is a boolean indicating if there</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is an incoming carry. They produce two results: the normal result of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// add or sub, and a boolean that indicates if an overflow occurred (&#42;not&#42;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// flag, because it may be a store to memory, etc.). If the type of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// boolean is not i1 then the high bits conform to getBooleanContents.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af9eda6a77c3228cd36537469a7425133"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af9eda6a77c3228cd36537469a7425133">SADDO&#95;CARRY</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a139dc5419039d94496e69dbb264251b5"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a139dc5419039d94496e69dbb264251b5">SSUBO&#95;CARRY</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// RESULT, BOOL = &#91;SU&#93;ADDO(LHS, RHS) - Overflow-aware nodes for addition.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These nodes take two operands: the normal LHS and RHS to the add. They</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// produce two results: the normal result of the add, and a boolean that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// indicates if an overflow occurred (&#42;not&#42; a flag, because it may be store</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to memory, etc.).  If the type of the boolean is not i1 then the high</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// bits conform to getBooleanContents.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These nodes are generated from llvm.&#91;su&#93;add.with.overflow intrinsics.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00467" /><CodeLine lineNumber="467"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = STRICT&#95;FP&#95;ROUND(Y, TRUNC) - Rounding &#39;Y&#39; from a larger floating</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00468" /><CodeLine lineNumber="468"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// point type down to the precision of the destination VT.  TRUNC is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00469" /><CodeLine lineNumber="469"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// flag, which is always an integer that is zero or one.  If TRUNC is 0,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00470" /><CodeLine lineNumber="470"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// this is a normal rounding, if it is 1, this FP&#95;ROUND is known to not</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00471" /><CodeLine lineNumber="471"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// change the value of Y.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00472" /><CodeLine lineNumber="472"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00473" /><CodeLine lineNumber="473"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The TRUNC = 1 case is used in cases where we know that the value will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00474" /><CodeLine lineNumber="474"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not be modified by the node, because Y is not using any of the extra</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00475" /><CodeLine lineNumber="475"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// precision of source type.  This allows certain transformations like</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00476" /><CodeLine lineNumber="476"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// STRICT&#95;FP&#95;EXTEND(STRICT&#95;FP&#95;ROUND(X,1)) -&gt; X which are not safe for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00477" /><CodeLine lineNumber="477"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// STRICT&#95;FP&#95;EXTEND(STRICT&#95;FP&#95;ROUND(X,0)) because the extra bits aren&#39;t</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00478" /><CodeLine lineNumber="478"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// removed.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00479" /><CodeLine lineNumber="479"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// It is used to limit optimizations while the DAG is being optimized.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00480" /><CodeLine lineNumber="480" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac2273d9cd04ba6e4a7c1a4b28ab1aaba"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac2273d9cd04ba6e4a7c1a4b28ab1aaba">STRICT&#95;FP&#95;ROUND</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="555"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// lengths of the input vectors. If VECTOR0 is a fixed-width vector, then</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="556"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// VECTOR1..VECTORN must all be fixed-width vectors. Similarly, if VECTOR0</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="560"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// INSERT&#95;SUBVECTOR(VECTOR1, VECTOR2, IDX) - Returns a vector with VECTOR2</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="561"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// inserted into VECTOR1. IDX represents the starting element number at which</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00562" /><CodeLine lineNumber="562"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// VECTOR2 will be inserted. IDX must be a constant multiple of T&#39;s known</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00563" /><CodeLine lineNumber="563"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// minimum vector length. Let the type of VECTOR2 be T, then if T is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// scalable vector, IDX is first scaled by the runtime scaling factor of T.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The elements of VECTOR1 starting at IDX are overwritten with VECTOR2.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Elements IDX through (IDX + num&#95;elements(T) - 1) must be valid VECTOR1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00567" /><CodeLine lineNumber="567"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// indices. If this condition cannot be determined statically but is false at</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// runtime, then the result vector is undefined. The IDX parameter must be a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// vector index constant type, which for most targets will be an integer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pointer type.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This operation supports inserting a fixed-width vector into a scalable</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// vector, but not the other way around.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00624" /><CodeLine lineNumber="624"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   RESULT&#91;i&#93; = CONCAT&#95;VECTORS(VEC1,VEC2)&#91;VEC1.ElementCount - ABS(IMM) + i&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00625" /><CodeLine lineNumber="625"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If IMM is not in the range &#91;-VL, VL-1&#93; the result vector is undefined. IMM</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the operand must match the vector element type, except when they</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SPLAT&#95;VECTOR(VAL) - Returns a vector with the scalar value VAL</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// duplicated in all lanes. The type of the operand must match the vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// element type, except when they are integer types.  In this case the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand is allowed to be wider than the vector element type, and is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="641"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// implicitly truncated to it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="642" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a7f864031b6fb691b1525cbea92542ef1"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a7f864031b6fb691b1525cbea92542ef1">SPLAT&#95;VECTOR</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SPLAT&#95;VECTOR&#95;PARTS(SCALAR1, SCALAR2, ...) - Returns a vector with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00645" /><CodeLine lineNumber="645"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// scalar values joined together and then duplicated in all lanes. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// represents a SPLAT&#95;VECTOR that has had its scalar operand expanded. This</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00647" /><CodeLine lineNumber="647"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// allows representing a 64-bit splat on a target with 32-bit integers. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00648" /><CodeLine lineNumber="648"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// total width of the scalars must cover the element width. SCALAR1 contains</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the least significant bits of the value regardless of endianness and all</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00650" /><CodeLine lineNumber="650"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// scalars should have the same type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad358f0823a936bde7edd419ab1058bd4"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ad358f0823a936bde7edd419ab1058bd4">SPLAT&#95;VECTOR&#95;PARTS</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00657" /><CodeLine lineNumber="657"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// element.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00658" /><CodeLine lineNumber="658"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00666" /><CodeLine lineNumber="666"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///         --&gt; &#123;A, C, ?, ?&#125; where ? is undefined</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00719" /><CodeLine lineNumber="719"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Shift and rotation operations.  After legalization, the type of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00720" /><CodeLine lineNumber="720"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// shift amount is known to be TLI.getShiftAmountTy().  Before legalization</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00758" /><CodeLine lineNumber="758"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00759" /><CodeLine lineNumber="759"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Select with a vector condition (op #0) and two vector operands (ops #1</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00760" /><CodeLine lineNumber="760"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and #2), returning a vector result.  All vectors have the same length.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00761" /><CodeLine lineNumber="761"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Much like the scalar select and setcc, each bit in the condition selects</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00762" /><CodeLine lineNumber="762"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// whether the corresponding result element is taken from op #1 or op #2.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00763" /><CodeLine lineNumber="763"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// At first, the VSELECT condition is of vXi1 type. Later, targets may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00764" /><CodeLine lineNumber="764"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// change the condition type in order to match the VSELECT node using a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00765" /><CodeLine lineNumber="765"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pattern. The condition follows the BooleanContent format of the target.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00766" /><CodeLine lineNumber="766" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0b7d2c769fd0fbaab3c4a2fc8e7ea0c"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ab0b7d2c769fd0fbaab3c4a2fc8e7ea0c">VSELECT</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00767" /><CodeLine lineNumber="767"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00768" /><CodeLine lineNumber="768"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Select with condition operator - This selects between a true value and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00769" /><CodeLine lineNumber="769"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a false value (ops #2 and #3) based on the boolean result of comparing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00770" /><CodeLine lineNumber="770"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the lhs and rhs (ops #0 and #1) of a conditional expression with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// condition code in op #4, a CondCodeSDNode.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SetCC operator - This evaluates to a true value iff the condition is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// true.  If the result value type is not i1 then the high bits conform</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to getBooleanContents.  The operands to this are the left and right</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operands to compare (ops #0, and #1) and the condition code to compare</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// them with (op #2) as a CondCodeSDNode. If the operands are vector types</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// then the result type must also be a vector type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a0158ee47dfa868be5d28e2cbef70d5d0"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a0158ee47dfa868be5d28e2cbef70d5d0">SETCC</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Like SetCC, ops #0 and #1 are the LHS and RHS operands to compare, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00783" /><CodeLine lineNumber="783"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// op #2 is a boolean indicating if there is an incoming carry. This</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00785" /><CodeLine lineNumber="785"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// compare two wide integers:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00786" /><CodeLine lineNumber="786"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// (setcccarry lhshi rhshi (usubo&#95;carry lhslo rhslo) cc).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00787" /><CodeLine lineNumber="787"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Only valid for integers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00788" /><CodeLine lineNumber="788" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a6bb33e400f29724907dc27ced04e9038"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a6bb33e400f29724907dc27ced04e9038">SETCCCARRY</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00789" /><CodeLine lineNumber="789"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00790" /><CodeLine lineNumber="790"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SHL&#95;PARTS/SRA&#95;PARTS/SRL&#95;PARTS - These operators are used for expanded</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00793" /><CodeLine lineNumber="793"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     &#91;Lo,Hi&#93; = op &#91;LoLHS,HiLHS&#93;, Amt</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00794" /><CodeLine lineNumber="794" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aeb80f9832dad739ee9c6deaa3110d98f"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aeb80f9832dad739ee9c6deaa3110d98f">SHL&#95;PARTS</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00795" /><CodeLine lineNumber="795" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a78139be59781ad05e1698eb95c58e0b1"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a78139be59781ad05e1698eb95c58e0b1">SRA&#95;PARTS</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00797" /><CodeLine lineNumber="797"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00805" /><CodeLine lineNumber="805" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a5183f3d72924bc7c77ba8d3f5de9f602"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a5183f3d72924bc7c77ba8d3f5de9f602">SIGN&#95;EXTEND</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00816" /><CodeLine lineNumber="816"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TRUNCATE - Completely drop the high bits.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae690127648393001a7d5b93dc23da7b3"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae690127648393001a7d5b93dc23da7b3">TRUNCATE</a>,</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TRUNCATE&#95;&#91;SU&#93;SAT&#95;&#91;SU&#93; - Truncate for saturated operand</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#91;SU&#93; located in middle, prefix for &#96;SAT&#96; means indicates whether</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// existing truncate target was a signed operation. For examples,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If &#96;truncate(smin(smax(x, C), C))&#96; was saturated then become &#96;S&#96;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If &#96;truncate(umin(x, C))&#96; was saturated then become &#96;U&#96;.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#91;SU&#93; located in last indicates whether range of truncated values is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sign-saturated. For example, if &#96;truncate(smin(smax(x, C), C))&#96; is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// truncation to &#96;i8&#96;, then if value of C ranges from &#96;-128 to 127&#96;, it will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be saturated against signed values, resulting in &#96;S&#96;, which will combine</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to &#96;TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;S&#96;. If the value of C ranges from &#96;0 to 255&#96;, it will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// be saturated against unsigned values, resulting in &#96;U&#96;, which will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// combine to &#96;TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;U&#96;. Similarly, in &#96;truncate(umin(x, C))&#96;, if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value of C ranges from &#96;0 to 255&#96;, it becomes &#96;U&#96; because it is saturated</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for unsigned values. As a result, it combines to &#96;TRUNCATE&#95;USAT&#95;U&#96;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af78365e835dbc10df18c1cd5d8853fd0"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af78365e835dbc10df18c1cd5d8853fd0">TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;S</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// saturate signed input to signed result -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><Highlight kind="normal">                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// truncate(smin(smax(x, C), C))</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a694c9a71596643f6ddd4ee767666cf43"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a694c9a71596643f6ddd4ee767666cf43">TRUNCATE&#95;SSAT&#95;U</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// saturate signed input to unsigned result -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><Highlight kind="normal">                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// truncate(smin(smax(x, 0), C))</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af81ec85e716e986c5555135612f62b29"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110af81ec85e716e986c5555135612f62b29">TRUNCATE&#95;USAT&#95;U</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// saturate unsigned input to unsigned result -</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><Highlight kind="normal">                   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// truncate(umin(x, C))</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// &#91;SU&#93;INT&#95;TO&#95;FP - These operators convert integers (whose interpreted sign</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00840" /><CodeLine lineNumber="840"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// depends on the first letter) to floating point.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00841" /><CodeLine lineNumber="841" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a315004656a75a3c3a9d7294f105a8da2"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a315004656a75a3c3a9d7294f105a8da2">SINT&#95;TO&#95;FP</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00842" /><CodeLine lineNumber="842" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a169032eecd015d4eeb869c457202a6c8"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a169032eecd015d4eeb869c457202a6c8">UINT&#95;TO&#95;FP</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00843" /><CodeLine lineNumber="843"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00844" /><CodeLine lineNumber="844"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;INREG - This operator atomically performs a SHL/SRA pair to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00845" /><CodeLine lineNumber="845"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// sign extend a small value in a large integer register (e.g. sign</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00846" /><CodeLine lineNumber="846"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// extending the low 8 bits of a 32-bit register to fill the top 24 bits</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00848" /><CodeLine lineNumber="848"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand, a ValueType node.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00849" /><CodeLine lineNumber="849" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aaa59dd5ec37f21905436b354c0292d9e"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aaa59dd5ec37f21905436b354c0292d9e">SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;INREG</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00850" /><CodeLine lineNumber="850"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00851" /><CodeLine lineNumber="851"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ANY&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG(Vector) - This operator represents an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00852" /><CodeLine lineNumber="852"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in-register any-extension of the low lanes of an integer vector. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00853" /><CodeLine lineNumber="853"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result type must have fewer elements than the operand type, and those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00854" /><CodeLine lineNumber="854"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// elements must be larger integer types such that the total size of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00855" /><CodeLine lineNumber="855"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand type is less than or equal to the size of the result type. Each</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00856" /><CodeLine lineNumber="856"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the low operand elements is any-extended into the corresponding,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00857" /><CodeLine lineNumber="857"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// wider result elements with the high bits becoming undef.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00858" /><CodeLine lineNumber="858"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NOTE: The type legalizer prefers to make the operand and result size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00859" /><CodeLine lineNumber="859"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the same to allow expansion to shuffle vector during op legalization.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00860" /><CodeLine lineNumber="860" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aaa275bf149ab5df1067cfb721936ecbc"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110aaa275bf149ab5df1067cfb721936ecbc">ANY&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00861" /><CodeLine lineNumber="861"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00862" /><CodeLine lineNumber="862"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG(Vector) - This operator represents an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00863" /><CodeLine lineNumber="863"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in-register sign-extension of the low lanes of an integer vector. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00864" /><CodeLine lineNumber="864"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result type must have fewer elements than the operand type, and those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00865" /><CodeLine lineNumber="865"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// elements must be larger integer types such that the total size of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00866" /><CodeLine lineNumber="866"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand type is less than or equal to the size of the result type. Each</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00867" /><CodeLine lineNumber="867"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the low operand elements is sign-extended into the corresponding,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00868" /><CodeLine lineNumber="868"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// wider result elements.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00869" /><CodeLine lineNumber="869"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NOTE: The type legalizer prefers to make the operand and result size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00870" /><CodeLine lineNumber="870"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the same to allow expansion to shuffle vector during op legalization.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00871" /><CodeLine lineNumber="871" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a3893859b5caa079593b9bf91b96e05fb"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a3893859b5caa079593b9bf91b96e05fb">SIGN&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00872" /><CodeLine lineNumber="872"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00873" /><CodeLine lineNumber="873"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ZERO&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG(Vector) - This operator represents an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00874" /><CodeLine lineNumber="874"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// in-register zero-extension of the low lanes of an integer vector. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00875" /><CodeLine lineNumber="875"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result type must have fewer elements than the operand type, and those</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00876" /><CodeLine lineNumber="876"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// elements must be larger integer types such that the total size of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00877" /><CodeLine lineNumber="877"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand type is less than or equal to the size of the result type. Each</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00878" /><CodeLine lineNumber="878"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of the low operand elements is zero-extended into the corresponding,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00879" /><CodeLine lineNumber="879"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// wider result elements.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00880" /><CodeLine lineNumber="880"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NOTE: The type legalizer prefers to make the operand and result size</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00881" /><CodeLine lineNumber="881"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the same to allow expansion to shuffle vector during op legalization.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00882" /><CodeLine lineNumber="882" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adf7f4fc30c272a1987e075d7470df84c"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adf7f4fc30c272a1987e075d7470df84c">ZERO&#95;EXTEND&#95;VECTOR&#95;INREG</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00883" /><CodeLine lineNumber="883"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00884" /><CodeLine lineNumber="884"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FP&#95;TO&#95;&#91;US&#93;INT - Convert a floating point value to a signed or unsigned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00885" /><CodeLine lineNumber="885"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// integer. These have the same semantics as fptosi and fptoui in IR. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00886" /><CodeLine lineNumber="886"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the FP value cannot fit in the integer type, the results are undefined.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00887" /><CodeLine lineNumber="887" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac3f8f8d8437c64b2e2e9f978e2707210"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ac3f8f8d8437c64b2e2e9f978e2707210">FP&#95;TO&#95;SINT</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00888" /><CodeLine lineNumber="888" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a71640703ec096a8b07111e85cfff6987"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a71640703ec096a8b07111e85cfff6987">FP&#95;TO&#95;UINT</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00889" /><CodeLine lineNumber="889"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00890" /><CodeLine lineNumber="890"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FP&#95;TO&#95;&#91;US&#93;INT&#95;SAT - Convert floating point value in operand 0 to a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00891" /><CodeLine lineNumber="891"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// signed or unsigned scalar integer type given in operand 1 with the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00892" /><CodeLine lineNumber="892"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// following semantics:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00893" /><CodeLine lineNumber="893"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00894" /><CodeLine lineNumber="894"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; If the value is NaN, zero is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00895" /><CodeLine lineNumber="895"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; If the value is larger/smaller than the largest/smallest integer,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00896" /><CodeLine lineNumber="896"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///    the largest/smallest integer is returned (saturation).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00897" /><CodeLine lineNumber="897"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  &#42; Otherwise the result of rounding the value towards zero is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00898" /><CodeLine lineNumber="898"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00899" /><CodeLine lineNumber="899"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The scalar width of the type given in operand 1 must be equal to, or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00900" /><CodeLine lineNumber="900"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// smaller than, the scalar result type width. It may end up being smaller</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00901" /><CodeLine lineNumber="901"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// than the result width as a result of integer type legalization.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00902" /><CodeLine lineNumber="902"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00903" /><CodeLine lineNumber="903"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// After converting to the scalar integer type in operand 1, the value is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00904" /><CodeLine lineNumber="904"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// extended to the result VT. FP&#95;TO&#95;SINT&#95;SAT sign extends and FP&#95;TO&#95;UINT&#95;SAT</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00905" /><CodeLine lineNumber="905"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// zero extends.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00906" /><CodeLine lineNumber="906" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae4a4e2126c6db34e2dfd71b6bd0408ee"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110ae4a4e2126c6db34e2dfd71b6bd0408ee">FP&#95;TO&#95;SINT&#95;SAT</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00907" /><CodeLine lineNumber="907" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a98661814400e72a77f5ed4e088c06937"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a98661814400e72a77f5ed4e088c06937">FP&#95;TO&#95;UINT&#95;SAT</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00908" /><CodeLine lineNumber="908"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00909" /><CodeLine lineNumber="909"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = FP&#95;ROUND(Y, TRUNC) - Rounding &#39;Y&#39; from a larger floating point type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00910" /><CodeLine lineNumber="910"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// down to the precision of the destination VT.  TRUNC is a flag, which is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00911" /><CodeLine lineNumber="911"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// always an integer that is zero or one.  If TRUNC is 0, this is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00912" /><CodeLine lineNumber="912"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// normal rounding, if it is 1, this FP&#95;ROUND is known to not change the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00913" /><CodeLine lineNumber="913"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value of Y.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00914" /><CodeLine lineNumber="914"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00915" /><CodeLine lineNumber="915"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The TRUNC = 1 case is used in cases where we know that the value will</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00916" /><CodeLine lineNumber="916"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// not be modified by the node, because Y is not using any of the extra</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00917" /><CodeLine lineNumber="917"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// precision of source type.  This allows certain transformations like</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00918" /><CodeLine lineNumber="918"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FP&#95;EXTEND(FP&#95;ROUND(X,1)) -&gt; X which are not safe for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00919" /><CodeLine lineNumber="919"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FP&#95;EXTEND(FP&#95;ROUND(X,0)) because the extra bits aren&#39;t removed.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00920" /><CodeLine lineNumber="920" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adaf9a3cb5c2ef5eb713bd6bf4ae23aeb"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110adaf9a3cb5c2ef5eb713bd6bf4ae23aeb">FP&#95;ROUND</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00921" /><CodeLine lineNumber="921"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00922" /><CodeLine lineNumber="922"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns current rounding mode:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00923" /><CodeLine lineNumber="923"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// -1 Undefined</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00924" /><CodeLine lineNumber="924"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  0 Round to 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00925" /><CodeLine lineNumber="925"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  1 Round to nearest, ties to even</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00926" /><CodeLine lineNumber="926"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  2 Round to +inf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00927" /><CodeLine lineNumber="927"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  3 Round to -inf</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00928" /><CodeLine lineNumber="928"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  4 Round to nearest, ties to zero</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00929" /><CodeLine lineNumber="929"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  Other values are target dependent.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00930" /><CodeLine lineNumber="930"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Result is rounding mode and chain. Input is a chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00931" /><CodeLine lineNumber="931" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a89f3afc3fa907ff83759c6c76d97a973"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#a22ea9cec080dd5f4f47ba234c2f59110a89f3afc3fa907ff83759c6c76d97a973">GET&#95;ROUNDING</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00932" /><CodeLine lineNumber="932"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00933" /><CodeLine lineNumber="933"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Set rounding mode.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00934" /><CodeLine lineNumber="934"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The first operand is a chain pointer. The second specifies the required</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00935" /><CodeLine lineNumber="935"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// rounding mode, encoded in the same way as used in &#39;&#96;&#96;GET&#95;ROUNDING&#96;&#96;&#39;.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00936" /><CodeLine lineNumber="936"><Highlight kind="normal">  SET&#95;ROUNDING,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00937" /><CodeLine lineNumber="937"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00938" /><CodeLine lineNumber="938"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// X = FP&#95;EXTEND(Y) - Extend a smaller FP type into a larger FP type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00940" /><CodeLine lineNumber="940"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00941" /><CodeLine lineNumber="941"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BITCAST - This operator converts between integer, vector and FP</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00942" /><CodeLine lineNumber="942"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values, as if the value was stored to memory with one type and loaded</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00943" /><CodeLine lineNumber="943"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// from the same address with the other type (or equivalently for vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00944" /><CodeLine lineNumber="944"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// format conversions, etc).  The source and result are required to have</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00945" /><CodeLine lineNumber="945"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the same bit size (e.g.  f32 &lt;-&gt; i32).  This can also be used for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00946" /><CodeLine lineNumber="946"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// int-to-int or fp-to-fp conversions, but that is a noop, deleted by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00947" /><CodeLine lineNumber="947"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// getNode().</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00948" /><CodeLine lineNumber="948"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00949" /><CodeLine lineNumber="949"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This operator is subtly different from the bitcast instruction from</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00950" /><CodeLine lineNumber="950"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LLVM-IR since this node may change the bits in the register. For</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00951" /><CodeLine lineNumber="951"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// example, this occurs on big-endian NEON and big-endian MSA where the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00952" /><CodeLine lineNumber="952"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// layout of the bits in the register depends on the vector type and this</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00953" /><CodeLine lineNumber="953"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operator acts as a shuffle operation for some vector type combinations.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00954" /><CodeLine lineNumber="954"><Highlight kind="normal">  BITCAST,</Highlight></CodeLine>
