<Link id="l01020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1020"><Highlight kind="normal">  LLROUND,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1021"><Highlight kind="normal">  LRINT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1022"><Highlight kind="normal">  LLRINT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1023"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1024"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMINNUM/FMAXNUM - Perform floating-point minimum or maximum on two</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1025"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// values.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1026"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1027"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// In the case where a single input is a NaN (either signaling or quiet),</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1028"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the non-NaN input is returned.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1029"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1030"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The return value of (FMINNUM 0.0, -0.0) could be either 0 or -0.0.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1031"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMINNUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1032"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMAXNUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1033"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1034"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMINNUM&#95;IEEE/FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE - Perform floating-point minimumNumber or</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1035"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// maximumNumber on two values, following IEEE-754 definitions. This differs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1036"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// from FMINNUM/FMAXNUM in the handling of signaling NaNs, and signed zero.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1037"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1038"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If one input is a signaling NaN, returns a quiet NaN. This matches</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1039"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// IEEE-754 2008&#39;s minnum/maxnum behavior for signaling NaNs (which differs</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1040"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// from 2019).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1041"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1042"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These treat 0 as ordered less than +0, matching the behavior of IEEE-754</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1043"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// 2019&#39;s minimumNumber/maximumNumber.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1044"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMINNUM&#95;IEEE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1045"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1046"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01047" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1047"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMINIMUM/FMAXIMUM - NaN-propagating minimum/maximum that also treat 0</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1048"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// as less than 0.0. While FMINNUM&#95;IEEE/FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE follow IEEE 754-2008</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1049"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// semantics, FMINIMUM/FMAXIMUM follow IEEE 754-2019 semantics.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1050"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMINIMUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01051" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1051"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMAXIMUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01052" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1052"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01053" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1053"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMINIMUMNUM/FMAXIMUMNUM - minimumnum/maximumnum that is same with</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01054" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1054"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMINNUM&#95;IEEE and FMAXNUM&#95;IEEE besides if either operand is sNaN.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01055" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1055"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMINIMUMNUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01056" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1056"><Highlight kind="normal">  FMAXIMUMNUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01057" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1057"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01058" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1058"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FSINCOS - Compute both fsin and fcos as a single operation.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01059" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1059"><Highlight kind="normal">  FSINCOS,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01060" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1060"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1061"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Gets the current floating-point environment. The first operand is a token</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01062" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1062"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chain. The results are FP environment, represented by an integer value,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01063" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1063"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and a token chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1064"><Highlight kind="normal">  GET&#95;FPENV,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1065"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1066"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Sets the current floating-point environment. The first operand is a token</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1067"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chain, the second is FP environment, represented by an integer value. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1068"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result is a token chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1069"><Highlight kind="normal">  SET&#95;FPENV,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1070"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1071"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Set floating-point environment to default state. The first operand and the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1072"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// result are token chains.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1073"><Highlight kind="normal">  RESET&#95;FPENV,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1074"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1075"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Gets the current floating-point environment. The first operand is a token</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1076"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chain, the second is a pointer to memory, where FP environment is stored</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1077"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to. The result is a token chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1078"><Highlight kind="normal">  GET&#95;FPENV&#95;MEM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1079"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1080"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Sets the current floating point environment. The first operand is a token</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01081" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1081"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chain, the second is a pointer to memory, where FP environment is loaded</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01082" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1082"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// from. The result is a token chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01083" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1083"><Highlight kind="normal">  SET&#95;FPENV&#95;MEM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01084" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1084"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01085" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1085"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Reads the current dynamic floating-point control modes. The operand is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1086"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a token chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1087"><Highlight kind="normal">  GET&#95;FPMODE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01088" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1088"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01089" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1089"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Sets the current dynamic floating-point control modes. The first operand</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01090" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1090"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is a token chain, the second is control modes set represented as integer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01091" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1091"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1092"><Highlight kind="normal">  SET&#95;FPMODE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1093"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1094"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Sets default dynamic floating-point control modes. The operand is a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1095"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// token chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1096"><Highlight kind="normal">  RESET&#95;FPMODE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1097"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1098"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// LOAD and STORE have token chains as their first operand, then the same</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1099"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operands as an LLVM load/store instruction, then an offset node that</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1100"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is added / subtracted from the base pointer to form the address (for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1101"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// indexed memory ops).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1102"><Highlight kind="normal">  LOAD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1103"><Highlight kind="normal">  STORE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1104"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1105"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// DYNAMIC&#95;STACKALLOC - Allocate some number of bytes on the stack aligned</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1106"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to a specified boundary.  This node always has two return values: a new</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1107"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// stack pointer value and a chain. The first operand is the token chain,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1108"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the second is the number of bytes to allocate, and the third is the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1109"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// alignment boundary.  The size is guaranteed to be a multiple of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1110"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// stack alignment, and the alignment is guaranteed to be bigger than the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1111"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// stack alignment (if required) or 0 to get standard stack alignment.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1112"><Highlight kind="normal">  DYNAMIC&#95;STACKALLOC,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Control flow instructions.  These all have token chains.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1115"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BR - Unconditional branch.  The first operand is the chain</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand, the second is the MBB to branch to.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1118"><Highlight kind="normal">  BR,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1119"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1120"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BRIND - Indirect branch.  The first operand is the chain, the second</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1121"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is the value to branch to, which must be of the same type as the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// target&#39;s pointer type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1123"><Highlight kind="normal">  BRIND,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1124"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1125"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BR&#95;JT - Jumptable branch. The first operand is the chain, the second</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1126"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is the jumptable index, the last one is the jumptable entry index.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1127"><Highlight kind="normal">  BR&#95;JT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1128"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// JUMP&#95;TABLE&#95;DEBUG&#95;INFO - Jumptable debug info. The first operand is the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chain, the second is the jumptable index.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1131"><Highlight kind="normal">  JUMP&#95;TABLE&#95;DEBUG&#95;INFO,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1132"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1133"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BRCOND - Conditional branch.  The first operand is the chain, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1134"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// second is the condition, the third is the block to branch to if the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1135"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// condition is true.  If the type of the condition is not i1, then the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// high bits must conform to getBooleanContents. If the condition is undef,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// it nondeterministically jumps to the block.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1138"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// TODO: Its semantics w.r.t undef requires further discussion; we need to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// make it sure that it is consistent with optimizations in MIR &amp; the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// meaning of IMPLICIT&#95;DEF. See https://reviews.llvm.org/D92015</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1141"><Highlight kind="normal">  BRCOND,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1142"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// BR&#95;CC - Conditional branch.  The behavior is like that of SELECT&#95;CC, in</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// that the condition is represented as condition code, and two nodes to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// compare, rather than as a combined SetCC node.  The operands in order</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// are chain, cc, lhs, rhs, block to branch to if condition is true. If</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1147"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// condition is undef, it nondeterministically jumps to the block.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1148"><Highlight kind="normal">  BR&#95;CC,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1149"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1150"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// INLINEASM - Represents an inline asm block.  This node always has two</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1151"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// return values: a chain and a flag result.  The inputs are as follows:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1152"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Operand #0  : Input chain.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1153"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Operand #1  : a ExternalSymbolSDNode with a pointer to the asm string.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1154"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Operand #2  : a MDNodeSDNode with the !srcloc metadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1155"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Operand #3  : HasSideEffect, IsAlignStack bits.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1156"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   After this, it is followed by a list of operands with this format:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1157"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ConstantSDNode: Flags that encode whether it is a mem or not, the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1158"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///                     of operands that follow, etc.  See InlineAsm.h.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1159"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     ... however many operands ...</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1160"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   Operand #last: Optional, an incoming flag.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1161"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The variable width operands are required to represent target addressing</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1163"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// modes as a single &quot;operand&quot;, even though they may have multiple</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1164"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// SDOperands.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1165"><Highlight kind="normal">  INLINEASM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1166"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1167"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// INLINEASM&#95;BR - Branching version of inline asm. Used by asm-goto.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1168"><Highlight kind="normal">  INLINEASM&#95;BR,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1169"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1170"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// EH&#95;LABEL - Represents a label in mid basic block used to track</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1171"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// locations needed for debug and exception handling tables.  These nodes</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1172"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// take a chain as input and return a chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01173" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1173"><Highlight kind="normal">  EH&#95;LABEL,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01174" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1174"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01175" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1175"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// ANNOTATION&#95;LABEL - Represents a mid basic block label used by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1176"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// annotations. This should remain within the basic block and be ordered</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1177"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// with respect to other call instructions, but loads and stores may float</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1178"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// past it.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1179"><Highlight kind="normal">  ANNOTATION&#95;LABEL,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1180"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1181"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CATCHRET - Represents a return from a catch block funclet. Used for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1182"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MSVC compatible exception handling. Takes a chain operand and a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1183"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// destination basic block operand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1184"><Highlight kind="normal">  CATCHRET,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1185"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1186"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CLEANUPRET - Represents a return from a cleanup block funclet.  Used for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1187"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// MSVC compatible exception handling. Takes only a chain operand.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1188"><Highlight kind="normal">  CLEANUPRET,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1189"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01190" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1190"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// STACKSAVE - STACKSAVE has one operand, an input chain.  It produces a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01191" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1191"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// value, the same type as the pointer type for the system, and an output</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1192"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01193" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1193"><Highlight kind="normal">  STACKSAVE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01194" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1194"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01195" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1195"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// STACKRESTORE has two operands, an input chain and a pointer to restore</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01196" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1196"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// to it returns an output chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01197" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1197"><Highlight kind="normal">  STACKRESTORE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01198" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1198"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01199" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1199"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CALLSEQ&#95;START/CALLSEQ&#95;END - These operators mark the beginning and end</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01200" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1200"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// of a call sequence, and carry arbitrary information that target might</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1201"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// want to know.  The first operand is a chain, the rest are specified by</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01202" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1202"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the target and not touched by the DAG optimizers.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01203" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1203"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Targets that may use stack to pass call arguments define additional</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01204" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1204"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operands:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01205" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1205"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - size of the call frame part that must be set up within the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01206" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1206"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   CALLSEQ&#95;START..CALLSEQ&#95;END pair,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01207" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1207"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// - part of the call frame prepared prior to CALLSEQ&#95;START.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01208" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1208"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Both these parameters must be constants, their sum is the total call</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01209" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1209"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// frame size.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01210" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1210"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// CALLSEQ&#95;START..CALLSEQ&#95;END pairs may not be nested.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1211"><Highlight kind="normal">  CALLSEQ&#95;START, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Beginning of a call sequence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1212"><Highlight kind="normal">  CALLSEQ&#95;END,   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// End of a call sequence</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1213"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1214"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// VAARG - VAARG has four operands: an input chain, a pointer, a SRCVALUE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1215"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and the alignment. It returns a pair of values: the vaarg value and a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1216"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// new chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1217"><Highlight kind="normal">  VAARG,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01385" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1385"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// GC&#95;TRANSITION&#95;START/GC&#95;TRANSITION&#95;END - These operators mark the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01386" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1386"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// beginning and end of GC transition  sequence, and carry arbitrary</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01387" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1387"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// information that target might need for lowering.  The first operand is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01388" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1388"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a chain, the rest are specified by the target and not touched by the DAG</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01389" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1389"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// optimizers. GC&#95;TRANSITION&#95;START..GC&#95;TRANSITION&#95;END pairs may not be</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01390" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1390"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// nested.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01391" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1391"><Highlight kind="normal">  GC&#95;TRANSITION&#95;START,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01392" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1392"><Highlight kind="normal">  GC&#95;TRANSITION&#95;END,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01393" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1393"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01394" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1394"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// GET&#95;DYNAMIC&#95;AREA&#95;OFFSET - get offset from native SP to the address of</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01395" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1395"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the most recent dynamic alloca. For most targets that would be 0, but</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01396" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1396"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// for some others (e.g. PowerPC, PowerPC64) that would be compile-time</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01397" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1397"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// known nonzero constant. The only operand here is the chain.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01398" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1398"><Highlight kind="normal">  GET&#95;DYNAMIC&#95;AREA&#95;OFFSET,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01399" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1399"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01400" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1400"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Pseudo probe for AutoFDO, as a place holder in a basic block to improve</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01401" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1401"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the sample counts quality.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01402" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1402"><Highlight kind="normal">  PSEUDO&#95;PROBE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01403" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1403"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01404" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1404"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// VSCALE(IMM) - Returns the runtime scaling factor used to calculate the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01405" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1405"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// number of elements within a scalable vector. IMM is a constant integer</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01406" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1406"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// multiplier that is applied to the runtime value.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01407" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1407"><Highlight kind="normal">  VSCALE,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01408" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1408"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01409" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1409"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Generic reduction nodes. These nodes represent horizontal vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01410" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1410"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// reduction operations, producing a scalar result.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01411" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1411"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The SEQ variants perform reductions in sequential order. The first</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01412" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1412"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// operand is an initial scalar accumulator value, and the second operand</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01413" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1413"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// is the vector to reduce.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01414" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1414"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// E.g. RES = VECREDUCE&#95;SEQ&#95;FADD f32 ACC, &lt;4 x f32&gt; SRC&#95;VEC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01415" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1415"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///  ... is equivalent to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01416" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1416"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// RES = (((ACC + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;0&#93;) + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;1&#93;) + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;2&#93;) + SRC&#95;VEC&#91;3&#93;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01417" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1417"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;SEQ&#95;FADD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01418" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1418"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;SEQ&#95;FMUL,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01419" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1419"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01420" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1420"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// These reductions have relaxed evaluation order semantics, and have a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01421" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1421"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// single vector operand. The order of evaluation is unspecified. For</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01422" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1422"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// pow-of-2 vectors, one valid legalizer expansion is to use a tree</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01423" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1423"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// reduction, i.e.:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01424" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1424"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For RES = VECREDUCE&#95;FADD &lt;8 x f16&gt; SRC&#95;VEC</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01425" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1425"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01426" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1426"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     PART&#95;RDX = FADD SRC&#95;VEC&#91;0:3&#93;, SRC&#95;VEC&#91;4:7&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01427" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1427"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     PART&#95;RDX2 = FADD PART&#95;RDX&#91;0:1&#93;, PART&#95;RDX&#91;2:3&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01428" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1428"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///     RES = FADD PART&#95;RDX2&#91;0&#93;, PART&#95;RDX2&#91;1&#93;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01429" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1429"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01430" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1430"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For non-pow-2 vectors, this can be computed by extracting each element</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01431" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1431"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and performing the operation as if it were scalarized.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01432" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1432"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;FADD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01433" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1433"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMUL,</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01434" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1434"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMIN/FMAX nodes can have flags, for NaN/NoNaN variants.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01435" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1435"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMAX,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01436" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1436"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMIN,</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01437" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1437"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// FMINIMUM/FMAXIMUM nodes propatate NaNs and signed zeroes using the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01438" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1438"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// llvm.minimum and llvm.maximum semantics.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01439" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1439"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMAXIMUM,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01440" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1440"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;FMINIMUM,</Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01441" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1441"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Integer reductions may have a result type larger than the vector element</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01442" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1442"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// type. However, the reduction is performed using the vector element type</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01443" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1443"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// and the value in the top bits is unspecified.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01444" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1444"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;ADD,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01445" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1445"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;MUL,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01446" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1446"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;AND,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01447" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1447"><Highlight kind="normal">  VECREDUCE&#95;OR,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01453" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1453"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01532" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1532"><Highlight kind="comment">/// MemIndexedMode enum - This enum defines the load / store indexed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01533" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1533"><Highlight kind="comment">/// addressing modes.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01534" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1534"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01535" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1535"><Highlight kind="comment">/// UNINDEXED    &quot;Normal&quot; load / store. The effective address is already</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01536" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1536"><Highlight kind="comment">///              computed and is available in the base pointer. The offset</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01537" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1537"><Highlight kind="comment">///              operand is always undefined. In addition to producing a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01538" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1538"><Highlight kind="comment">///              chain, an unindexed load produces one value (result of the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01539" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1539"><Highlight kind="comment">///              load); an unindexed store does not produce a value.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01540" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1540"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01541" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1541"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PRE&#95;INC      Similar to the unindexed mode where the effective address is</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01542" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1542"><Highlight kind="comment">/// PRE&#95;DEC      the value of the base pointer add / subtract the offset.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01543" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1543"><Highlight kind="comment">///              It considers the computation as being folded into the load /</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01544" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1544"><Highlight kind="comment">///              store operation (i.e. the load / store does the address</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01545" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1545"><Highlight kind="comment">///              computation as well as performing the memory transaction).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01546" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1546"><Highlight kind="comment">///              The base operand is always undefined. In addition to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01547" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1547"><Highlight kind="comment">///              producing a chain, pre-indexed load produces two values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01548" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1548"><Highlight kind="comment">///              (result of the load and the result of the address</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01549" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1549"><Highlight kind="comment">///              computation); a pre-indexed store produces one value (result</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1550"><Highlight kind="comment">///              of the address computation).</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1551"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01552" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1552"><Highlight kind="comment">/// POST&#95;INC     The effective address is the value of the base pointer. The</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01553" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1553"><Highlight kind="comment">/// POST&#95;DEC     value of the offset operand is then added to / subtracted</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01554" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1554"><Highlight kind="comment">///              from the base after memory transaction. In addition to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01555" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1555"><Highlight kind="comment">///              producing a chain, post-indexed load produces two values</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01556" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1556"><Highlight kind="comment">///              (the result of the load and the result of the base +/- offset</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01557" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1557"><Highlight kind="comment">///              computation); a post-indexed store produces one value (the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01558" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1558"><Highlight kind="comment">///              the result of the base +/- offset computation).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1559" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31">MemIndexedMode</a> &#123; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31ade1c53e7b8a373e22ec53ff7bcbace9f">UNINDEXED</a> = 0, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31ab5bb854fadd42503c849c4a48d7f3d90">PRE&#95;INC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a57c3822f99653c422d5a21206adc6e42">PRE&#95;DEC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a866c29237765ff291c9503abbdca60e1">POST&#95;INC</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a10a4094c81c0b9cd5e82e53b48932203">POST&#95;DEC</a> &#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01560" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1560"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01561" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1561" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ae0010333b4e1424ce473b508d802bbbd"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ae0010333b4e1424ce473b508d802bbbd">LAST&#95;INDEXED&#95;MODE</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#abee7ecb577fcade34eb16ccb7f503e31a10a4094c81c0b9cd5e82e53b48932203">POST&#95;DEC</a> + 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1597"><Highlight kind="comment">/// ISD::CondCode enum - These are ordered carefully to make the bitfields</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1598"><Highlight kind="comment">/// below work out, when considering SETFALSE (something that never exists</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1599"><Highlight kind="comment">/// dynamically) as 0  &quot;U&quot; -&gt; Unsigned (for integer operands) or Unordered</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01600" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1600"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (for floating point), &quot;L&quot; -&gt; Less than, &quot;G&quot; -&gt; Greater than, &quot;E&quot; -&gt; Equal</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01601" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1601"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to.  If the &quot;N&quot; column is 1, the result of the comparison is undefined if</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01602" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1602"><Highlight kind="comment">/// the input is a NAN.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1603"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01604" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1604"><Highlight kind="comment">/// All of these (except for the &#39;always folded ops&#39;) should be handled for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01605" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1605"><Highlight kind="comment">/// floating point.  For integer, only the SETEQ,SETNE,SETLT,SETLE,SETGT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01606" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1606"><Highlight kind="comment">/// SETGE,SETULT,SETULE,SETUGT, and SETUGE opcodes are used.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01607" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1607"><Highlight kind="comment">///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01608" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1608"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Note that these are laid out in a specific order to allow bit-twiddling</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01609" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1609"><Highlight kind="comment">/// to transform conditions.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01610" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1610" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">enum</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07">CondCode</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01611" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1611"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Opcode       N U L G E       Intuitive operation</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01612" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1612" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07ae258b87332b47d96bdf47e4cd915f9ea"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07ae258b87332b47d96bdf47e4cd915f9ea">SETFALSE</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      0 0 0 0       Always false (always folded)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01613" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1613" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07a08c31033acfb9d6f0bc4a8a82cc26862"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07a08c31033acfb9d6f0bc4a8a82cc26862">SETOEQ</a>,   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      0 0 0 1       True if ordered and equal</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01614" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1614" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07a31d1e24e08b255d6aa290d67d16ce2c9"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07a31d1e24e08b255d6aa290d67d16ce2c9">SETOGT</a>,   </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      0 0 1 0       True if ordered and greater than</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01620" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1620" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07a48a334bbe606d5e82c9cd84eaa127b50"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/isd/#ac3c3cf58d6d631af6a172457304d3d07a48a334bbe606d5e82c9cd84eaa127b50">SETUO</a>,    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//      1 0 0 0       True if unordered: isnan(X) | isnan(Y)</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
